result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah N. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Noah N. Taylor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Noah N. Taylor was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Upon successful completion of probation, DE may renew his request in writing to the Court for expunction. Court may set for hearing and grant if satisfied.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. Perform 40 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah N. Taylor

records.addlTxt: 9:47 AM Defendant Noah N. Taylor in court.  Attorney David Patton in court for Noah N. Taylor.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  On state's motion, ct 2 is dismissed. DE enters NC plea to ct 1.  Court finds DE guilty of ct 1.  Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 1 year with conditions; bond applied to fees/costs; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.  Appeal rights given.  DE requests expunction.  Upon successful completion of probation, DE may renew his request in writing to the court. Court may set for hearing and grant if satisfied.

ADDRESS INFO for Noah N. Taylor
Current: 8817 17th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 4310 5th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53140

10:40 AM Defendant Noah N. Taylor in court.  Attorney David Patton in court for Noah N. Taylor.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Offer received. Negotiations continue.  FPT scheduled.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued posted
  *No Weapons especially firearms and edged weapons.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Miranda P and children of hers by 4pm today. Kares R, ELB, KPD Ofc Moretti except in professional capacity.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:58 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.. $450  Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
